comment.author: 76174767@N07
comment._content: Considering this picture, www.flickr.com/photos/brooklyn_museum/2486853608/in/set-7... , and a quick aerial check of the local geography on Google Maps, the two sculptures are at one end of the Grand Palais (since the Petit Palais looks quite different, as seen here : www.flickr.com/photos/brooklyn_museum/2485970303/in/set-7... ) In the first picture I mentioned, the Medecine Man is in front of a side entrance to the Grand Palais, while the statue of the man holding a rifle is hiding the Palais's main entrance, which is face to face with the Petit Palais' main entrance. So basically, these statues are between the Alexandre III bridge and the two Palais, on what is now called the Cours la Reine, right by the Seine. That makes it right in the middle of the exhibition area, and in the distance, you'd find the Place de la Concorde and all its Pavillions (hence the pointy thing we can see here). I'm pretty sure I'm right, but feel free to cross-check and prove me wrong.
